posts.title: Listen In: LES Oral History Montage
posts.text: This is a guest blog post by NYPL Community Oral History Project volunteer and audio producer, Walter Petrichyn. You can listen to Walter's podcast Mission Island, where he shares true and fictional stories that happen in cities.

posts.title: LES Oral History Project Kick-Off Event
posts.text: The goal of the neighborhood history project is to collect, document, and archive LES history through the eyes of local residents.

posts.title: Interviewers Needed: LES, Chinatown and Kips Bay!
posts.text: Collect NYC stories and make history. Volunteers needed in the LES, Chinatown, and Kips Bay.

posts.title: Volunteers Needed: Neighborhood Oral History Leaders
posts.text: We’re looking for volunteers to fill a new leadership role in this program and help build local collection efforts by facilitating oral history trainings and assisting the project manager in engaging volunteers through community events and regular communication.

posts.title: Stories from the Line: Waiting for Free Shakespeare
posts.text: Volunteer interviewers from the NYPL Community Oral History Project went on tour this month to the Delacorte Theater in Central Park to talk to people in line for The Public Theater’s annual Free Shakespeare in the Park. As regulars will tell you, waiting in line at the Delacorte is a truly unique city experience.

posts.title: How I Know Dr. Roscoe C. Brown
posts.text: Dr. Brown was one of the Tuskegee Airmen and a squadron commander 100th Fighter Squadron of the 332nd Fighter Group. This was Dr. Brown's last major interview before he passed away on July 2, 2016.

posts.title: Voices of NYC
posts.text: For the month of May, we’re showcasing thirty-one of the extraordinary stories that have been shared by New Yorkers throughout our city as part of The New York Public Library’s Community Oral History Project.

posts.title: Together We Listen: Make Hundreds of NYC Stories Accessible—One Word at a Time
posts.text: Are you familiar with the NYPL Community Oral History Project? Take a few moments to listen to some highlights or just dive right into our full collection of stories.

posts.title: Marymount Manhattan College Students Help Make Oral Histories Searchable
Stop, Transcribe, and Listen: Volunteer Experience with New Storytelling Tools
posts.text: A guest post from volunteer Kaitlin McClure about her experience tagging and transcript correcting.

posts.title: Voices from East of Bronx Park: The Stories That Aren't In the History Books
posts.text: This is a guest post from volunteer, Joanne Dillon. Joanne has interviewed several people for the NYPL Community Oral History Project and continues to share her experience and the experience of others who are participating in this historic initiative.

posts.title: Volunteers Capture Harlem's History
posts.text: Volunteers share their stories about capturing Harlem's history through interviews with residents.

posts.title: Share Your Stories: Celebrating the 50th Anniversary of the New York Philharmonic Parks Concerts
posts.text: This year, the New York Philharmonic celebrates 50 years of free concerts in New York City's parks. The New York Public Library will collaborate with the New York Philharmonic to gather New Yorkers' favorite recollections to be preserved for future generations.

posts.title: Meet Our Visible Lives Oral History Project Volunteers!
posts.text: This is a guest post by Joanne Dillon, interviewer for Visible Lives: Oral Histories of the Disability Experience at Andrew Heiskell Braille and Talking Book Library.

posts.title: Oral Histories for National Autism Awareness Month
Learn How NYC Women Continue to Make History with the Community Oral History Project
posts.text: March is Women’s History Month, a time when we pay special tribute to women whose contributions to society have proved invaluable. Find out how four extraordinary New York City women are currently making history in their local neighborhoods in these oral histories recently compiled and collected as part of our Community Oral History Project.

posts.title: Dedicated Oral History Volunteers Restore Her Faith in New Yorkers
posts.text: A guest post by Joanne Dillon, interviewer for Visible Lives: Oral Histories of the Disability Experience at Andrew Heiskell Braille and Talking Book Library.

posts.title: Audio Highlights from the Community Oral History Project
posts.text: Nine highlights from four distinct oral history projects—stories of the past and present history of these communities.

posts.title: Visible Lives Oral History Experience: Playing the Hand She Was Dealt
posts.text: This is a guest post by Joanne Dillon, interviewer for Visible Lives: Oral Histories of the Disability Experience at Andrew Heiskell Braille and Talking Book Library. Joanne conducted her first interview for the project with storyteller Ann Chiapetta on Saturday, December 20. After you read her post, you can listen to Joanne's interview with Ann.

posts.title: Voices from East of Bronx Park: Our Launch Event!
posts.text: Voices from East of Bronx Park is the first large scale effort to collect oral histories from people who have lived or worked in the Allerton, Pelham Parkway, Van Nest and Morris Park neighborhoods.

posts.title: My Interview with Daniel Aronoff: A Visible Lives Oral History Project Guest Blog
posts.text: This is a guest blog post by Deena Greenberg, interviewer for Visible Lives: Oral Histories of the Disability Experience at Andrew Heiskell Braille and Talking Book Library. Deena conducted her first interview for the project with storyteller Daniel Aronoff on Tuesday, November 18. After you read her post, you can listen to Deena’s interview with Daniel.

posts.title: Celebrating Our Launch: Visible Lives Oral History Project!
posts.text: On Saturday, November 22 at Andrew Heiskell Braille and Talking Book Library, we celebrated the launch of Visible Lives: Oral Histories of the Disability Experience, The New York Public Library’s community-based initiative to make public and preserve stories of the disability experience.

posts.title: Oral Histories of the Disability Experience: Share Your Story
posts.text: The Andrew Heiskell Braille and Talking Book Library is launching an oral history project that will be the largest community-based effort of its kind to collect and document stories of the disability experience, and we want you to share your story.

posts.title: Hear and Share Your Hurricane Sandy Stories with Sandy Storyline's Exhibit
posts.text: In recognition of the two-year anniversary of Hurricane Sandy, The New York Public Library is partnering with Sandy Storyline to present an opportunity to hear and share first person stories of recovery and remembrance.

posts.title: A People's History of Harlem: Celebrating Its Launch!
posts.text: As NYPL's oral history projects continue... we've launched our oral history project in Harlem at 115th Street Library!

posts.title: Memory Circles Bring History to Life at Jefferson Market Library
posts.text: Jefferson Market Library was alive with the energy of storytelling last Thursday, March 13th as storytellers and interviewers for the Greenwich Village Oral History Project took over the library. It was an evening of Memory Circles, or recorded group oral histories, in which participants talked with each other about their shared recollections on particular Greenwich Village themes.

posts.title: I Heard It Through The Grapevine: Reliving the History of Greenwich Village with Author John Strausbaugh
posts.text: “Greenwich Village is so steeped in history, there are literally a bazillion stories of this, the most famous neighborhood in the world.  Coming together in this tiny spec of real estate, people bounced off each other to become the cultural center of the country and the world.  I could have written 6 books on this topic,” said Strausbaugh in his opening remarks at Jefferson Market Library.

posts.title: Chatham Square Library Collects Lunar New Year Stories
posts.text: Chatham Square Library has 19 iPads available for patrons to record their Lunar New Year memories. These recordings will be available as part of a circulating collection and on The New York Public Library website in the upcoming months.

posts.title: Greenwich Village Oral History Project: Celebrating Its Launch
posts.text: On Thursday, January 16 a group of storytellers, interviewers and library staff gathered at Jefferson Market Library to celebrate the launch of Your Village, Your Story: Greenwich Village Oral History Project. On Thursday's kick-off event, the room was full of energy and with 30 oral histories collected already, there was plenty to celebrate!

posts.title: Vietnam Veterans Panel on November 5th: Opening Remarks
Your Village, Your Story: Jefferson Market's Greenwich Village Oral History Project Begins
Veterans Tell Their Own Stories: Fall 2013 Veterans Programming
Our Stories To Tell: Veterans Tell Their Own Stories at NYPL Panel
NYC Veterans Oral History Project Records Stories on Staten Island
Veterans Oral History Project: Get Involved
